website_summaries.verdict: Don't let the smiley face fool you — this fun tennis racket has features and quality that are ideal for teaching children the fundamentals and skills of the game.
pros: Offers a quality build comparable to adult models — aluminum construction and a lightweight feel
Comes in various sizes to fit each child's age range
cons: Strings have been known to break after relatively gentle use
A few complaints of the grips slipping-falling off

customer_reviews.title: It’s really great - and really small!
customer_reviews.text: I thought my 3.5 yr old would need the smallest racquet, but should have checked the age range guides online. It’s a really great racquet, but it is seriously small!! My kid is tall - this might work for an average size 3 year old - just do some research to get the right size :)
customer_reviews.author: A. L.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my sport-loving 2 year old
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly sized (17 inches) for my 2-year-old, who wants to play every sport he sees. Good grip and light-weight enough for him to get a good swing. It's held up well to racket tosses and general toddler craziness. My only suggestion for the company would be to reinforce the heel of the grip with plastic (vs the grip tape), as that is the spot that gets the most abuse, but after a whole season of playing, it's held up remarkably well.
customer_reviews.author: BG

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: My nearly 4 year old daughter really likes her "rocket." She initially wanted a pink and purple racket but after seeing this racket she was immediately satisfied. Also, the size of this racket has improved her ability to hit the ball during tennis lessons. The price of the product is extremely competitive for the intended purpose. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 5.5 year old
customer_reviews.text: Daughter loves. Perfect weight and height for her and perfect price for mom
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Racket bent, unusable
customer_reviews.text: I hate to be this guy, but the racket came badly bent, warped and the paint chipped in multiple places.
customer_reviews.author: John W

customer_reviews.title: great service
customer_reviews.text: The tennis racquets arrived and looked terrific. However for one the strings broke immediately, which shouldn't happen. I wrote and immediately, with no dispute, they sent a replacement. Great service.
customer_reviews.author: Waban Paul

customer_reviews.title: Super great racket for new learners!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic racket for a new tennis learner! My son started lessons and the racket we had was too big. This came really quick and it just the right size. He is 5 years old and it’s light enough that he can really get into the game without his arm getting tired. He also loves the smile on it!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Good racquet
customer_reviews.text: As a avid tennis player, I wanted to teach my son how to play tennis. So I Bought this racquet to teach my 2year old to play tennis. It’s good and lightweight for him. Unfortunately he likes to hit people instead of balls. So for now keeping it on the closet till he gets a bit older.
customer_reviews.author: Cloud

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and cute design
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this racket as a gift for our 2 year old son's birthday and liked it so much we bought a second one for our 4 year old daughter. The quality is excellent. The racket is small, so it is the perfect size for toddlers. Our son is not very gentle with it and it has held up really well after being dragged across the ground and being used to hit lots of things other than tennis balls. Sometimes my husband and I pick them up to volley back and forth a little bit. We'll get lots of use from these rackets this spring and summer. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Molly Leighton

customer_reviews.title: Great first tennis racquet.
customer_reviews.text: Great first racquet for my 2 1/2 year old grandson. It is too big for him so he had to choke up on the handle. But it will be good until he is about 10 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Erindan

customer_reviews.title: this racquet is great and she is enjoying her learning
customer_reviews.text: we got the 19 inches for a 4.5 y/o after finding that 17 is too small. this racquet is great and she is enjoying her learning.
customer_reviews.author: L&A

customer_reviews.title: Solid product
customer_reviews.text: Unexpectedly well made. Sure the review are good but until you actually have one in your hand you really just don’t know. But I’m impressed. Very light, very durable. Well done.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: my grand daughters seems to like it. now she has to use it.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 6 year old
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 6 year old who just started taking tennis lessons a few weeks ago. Right size, right weight, and cute happy face on the strings. Love it and so does she!

customer_reviews.title: These are the worst racquets ever
customer_reviews.text: These are the worst racquets ever. They are smaller than they looked on the site and the grips fell off after one use. Don't buy them.

customer_reviews.title: I like the weight and material
customer_reviews.text: I'm a teaching pro. I got this for my 2 year old daughter. It's the best weighted 17in racquet for her size/age. Good quality material too. Once shes a little bigger I'll transition her to the babolat 17in ballfighter which is a little more quality. This is def good for the moment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: I gave 3 little racqets to my daughter and 2 nephews for Christmas and they all loved them. The racqets are great quality and the strings are tight and professionally strung. My nephews parents are still raving about them and can’t wait to get them on the court. I’d recommend these racquets without hesitation!

We followed the size suggestions and ordered the pink one and she is THRILLED! She and Grandpa have a wonderful time playing each day!

product_meta.title: Street Tennis Club Tennis Rackets for Kids Proper Equipment Helps You Learn Faster and Play Better!
feature_bullets: HELPS IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF TENNIS SKILLS - Using the proper racket helps in the development of stroke mechanics and technique
HIGHER CHANCE OF TENNIS BALL CONTACT - Using the proper racket also helps in hitting the ball more often during a game or practice
CHOOSE FROM DIFFERENT SIZES - This racket is available in 17, 19, and 21 inch
GREAT BUILD AND FINISH - This racket is made from top-quality Aluminum and is available in different colors
FREE GAME INCLUDED - This tennis racket comes with a free video game that you can play on your driveway
